items.title: Who Pays When A.I. Is Wrong?
items.summary: New court cases seek to define content created by artificial intelligence as defamatory — a novel concept that has captivated some legal experts.

items.title: SoftBank Sells $5.8 Billion Stake in Nvidia to Pay for OpenAI Deals
items.summary: The move has further stoked concerns among some investors that the rally in artificial intelligence stocks was overdone.

items.title: Why Debt Funding Is Ratcheting Up the Risks of the A.I. Boom
items.summary: While the tech giants have plenty of money to build data centers, smaller outfits are taking on debt and taking big chances to work with them.

items.title: Is A.I. a Journalist or Just a Newsroom Tool?
items.summary: A.I. has set off industrywide soul-searching about its potential and pitfalls.

items.title: 5 Apps That Will Make You Love Art Galleries
items.summary: Craving an art fix but don’t know where to start? These new art influencers can help newbies and players navigate openings, events and listings.

items.title: The Luxury Electric Vehicle Is in Trouble
items.summary: Sales of expensive battery-powered cars like the Ford F-150 Lightning have stalled, forcing automakers to slow production and offer more affordable vehicles.

items.title: Northern Lights Are Beautiful, but for Satellites They’re Risky
items.summary: At least one space launch has been put on hold, as satellite operators and rocket companies manage the effects of the current geomagnetic storm hitting Earth.

items.title: Russian Humanoid Robot Falls on Its Face in Hyped Debut
items.summary: The robot, known as AIDOL, staggered onstage during a technology showcase in Moscow. Organizers blamed the mishap on calibration and lighting issues.

items.title: Solvay of Belgium Creates Rare Earths Deals With U.S.
items.summary: The contracts are the latest sign of how Europe is lagging the United States in the race to break China’s chokehold on rare earths.

items.title: At the Cybathlon, May the Best Brain-Computer Interface Win
items.summary: Every four years at the Cybathlon, teams of researchers and technology “pilots” compete to see whose brain-computer interface holds the most promise.

items.title: Missing at U.N.’s Climate Meeting: American Executives
items.summary: Many business leaders are skipping the annual United Nations climate summit in Belém, Brazil, or are attending events in other cities.

items.title: Blue Origin Scrubs Launch of NASA’s ESCAPADE Mission to Mars
items.summary: The second flight of the orbital rocket from Jeff Bezos’s space company was halted by weather. The company may try again on Wednesday.

items.title: China Resumes Some Chip Exports, Easing Fears of a Global Crunch
items.summary: A leading German automotive supplier said it was again allowed to ship semiconductors that Beijing had barred for export.

items.title: We Met NEO, the Viral Humanoid Robot + HatGPT
items.summary: People have been waiting for a robot to do their chores since they watched “The Jetsons.” Can the company behind NEO finally make it happen?

items.title: Lawsuits Blame ChatGPT for Suicides and Harmful Delusions
items.summary: Seven complaints, filed on Thursday, claim the popular chatbot encouraged dangerous discussions and led to mental breakdowns.

items.title: Elon Musk Wins $1 Trillion Tesla Pay Package
items.summary: Tesla shareholders approved a plan to grant Elon Musk shares worth nearly $1 trillion if he meets ambitious goals, including vastly expanding the company’s stock market valuation.

items.title: OpenAI Races to Quell Concerns Over Its Finances
items.summary: The A.I. company faced pushback after a top executive raised the idea of government aid, amid concerns that the A.I. industry is headed toward a dangerous bubble.

items.title: Government Shutdown Blame Game Plays Out Online and on TV
items.summary: A blame game has played out on the internet and on television. President Trump has pulled out the stops.

items.title: Are A.I. Therapy Chatbots Safe to Use?
items.summary: Psychologists and technologists see them as the future of therapy. The Food and Drug Administration is exploring whether to regulate them as medical devices.

items.title: How A.I. and Social Media Contribute to ‘Brain Rot’
items.summary: A.I. search tools, chatbots and social media are associated with lower cognitive performance, studies say. What to do?
